HAL.raw_line: I'm gay. Same camera angle, Hal still looking into camera we jump cut to him wearing a robe.I'm gay. Same angle, we continue to jump cut through Hal talking to camera, each cut in different clothes, and with each cut his line has a different inflection.I'm gay. Jump cut, new outfit.I loved your mother, but, uh... now I want to explore this side. Jump cut, new outfit.I don't want to be just theoretically gay, I want to do something about it. New outfit and inflection....I want to do something about it... New outfit and inflection....I want to do something about it.Oliver! Please help me with all these ropes. Oliver rushes and helps him.You two married?Why not? She's great. The nurse smiles, embarrassed, and continues with her job.You always have some very good reason, haven't you?Yeah, alright. Give me the flashlight. Oliver opens it, they look at a few pages together, photos of serene gardens.Oh, that's nice.Oh, yeah? Hal continues to direct the light across the room, we follow the circle of light as it moves a cross a wall landing on a painting.Oh, who did that painting?A--, and these?But how do they relate to the exhibit?Well, its beautiful.Putting the Japanese gardens there. It's just beautiful.Andy! Andy gets on the bed opposite Oliver. He gives Hal a big kiss on the lips. Hal glows. Oliver backs away slowly. Andy picks up Hal's hand, turns it palm up and presses his face into it.Oh, God. Andy pushes play, on the recording we hear Andy's voice:Oliver?I'm not sorry I woke you! I went to Akbar tonight.They had wonderfully loud music. In- sit, in-sit, in-sit. What kind of music is that?"House music."Young gay men don't go for older gay men.You have it easy.But...?Uh-huh. I see.No. Thank you. As the doctor leaves. Oliver takes his father's hand.Well, let's not rush out and tell everyone.No need to get him up a tree. Hal takes a moment and composes himself. In his eyes we can see that he knows there is an end to his life.Can you read me something?But is he eating?Oh God, I worry so much about-- As Andy enters, his hands mysteriously cupped together.Oh here we are... Andy shows Hal his cupped hands.What have you got in there?Oh, Andy, you can't bring that kind of thing in here.Fuck you. Oliver watches with amusement. NURSE SOPHIA enters...It's time for inspection... The nurse works her way between Andy and Hal to take his pulse.Hello. Andy feels interrupted, strangely hurt by the nurse. The nurse begins to take Hal's vital signs.Go take a walk. Calm yourself. Andy walks out, feeling embarrassed and rejected.Oh, Andy hasn't had it easy. Be nice to him. To everyone's surprise, Andy storms back in with a bouquet of flowers, dumps them on Hal's chest, kisses him triumphantly and leaves again.Andy, where did you get these?Oh, it's not? She shakes her head no, the party stops, she leaves. Oliver instinctively polite, starts packing up their cups.No, no, no. She's a wonderful nurse. Here's to health care. Hal swigs back his wine. They all laugh, grab their cups and toast.Oh, I invited him - but he never returns my calls. The guys drink merrily. Someone shoves a cup into Oliver's hand, pours him a drink.What happened with Michelle?She seemed great.Maybe you should take out a personal ad, where you explain your situation?Yeah, I mean, you want to be in a relationship but you can't stay in one.Well, a lot of people use them... I did.If Andy wasn't going to be monogamous, why should I be?Jesus yourself.Hello house Hello Hal. Andy holds Arthur. Hal and Arthur kiss. They've clearly missed each other. JUMP CUTS: Oliver takes bottles of pills and syrups and inhalers out of a Sav-On bag. He makes a chart of the medicine, the dosage, and puts the pills in a dish. It's emotional job for him.Oh God, what have you got this time?No, no, no, you don't have a green caterpillar.Oh my God. Gross! Oh, Jesus...Hey, you going?Oh. Right. Andy waves goodbye and leaves. Hal is sad but covering it up. He catches Oliver watching.Well, at least I'm the number one boyfriend. Hal grimaces in pain, doubles over.Oh, my stomach.Well, let's say, when you were little, you always dreamed of some day getting a lion? Oliver eases Hal down onto the couch.And you wait and you wait and you wait and you wait and the lion doesn't come. Then along comes a giraffe. Oliver helps Hal get his feet up.You can be alone or you can be with the giraffe.That's why I worry about you. Hal looks at Oliver with love and concern.You want me to be with someone like me. I like Andy cause he's not like me... he's fun.Oh, did I wake you? Yeah. Thank you Maria. And now that you're here, uh, would you please put those up there?I'm reorganizing.I'm just not sleepy. I feel great.As soon as I finish these papers. Right, papers? Right, Hal. As soon as you're done, you can rest. Oliver can only sit and worry.Oh, God.Hey, no, no, no. That's the Gay Pride Day stuff. Just leave those.And that's for gay book club. You better leave those too.The chair's not gay. Obviously. Hal gets up and walks to the kitchen, his oxygen cannon cord is attached to the pump behind him, stopping him short.Oh, to hell with it. Hal pulls off the oxygen and keeps walking, frail but determined. Andy enters with a large pilates ball.Oh, hey what's that?That's a great idea.Yeah, later on, I'm gonna make myself some tea.Your mother's vase needs some flowers. Oliver looks at them frustrated and uneasy...You'll tell him, won't you? Oliver's flabbergasted, but his dad's vulnerability is clear to him.Please?That's okay.For someone with so much relationship advice, you seem awfully alone. Oliver, angry but at a loss for words, takes the flower vase and leaves, Arthur follows.Oliver, this is Blake. He's a wonderful man. CU of the small round registration tattoos on Hal's chestLook. I finally got a tattoo. Registration purposes of course.Well, glad you could make it.It's movie night. Oliver and Hal make their way through a crowd of Hal's gay friends. They're in party mode.Oh, I'm turning the corner on this thing. We loose Hal and Oliver in the group...Well...It's not as bad as it sounds.That's not what it means.It just means it's been through 3 other stages. Oliver doesn't know what to say, he looks through the door at all of Hal's friends -- happy, laughing, partying. He looks back at Hal, ready to fight him more, but for the first time we can see fear and doubt in Hal's face."The Life of Harvey Milk." He was the first openly gay politician...Good, good.Eventually Jesus grew old. He could no longer walk far and he could no longer preach in a loud voice. One day he announced to his apostles that he was departing. The three disciples prayed with him, gave him water, bathed and fed him. After gasping for breath for several days, one morning, just as dawn came, Jesus passed away.It was so violent, we need new stories. Oliver goes over and kisses Hal on the head.Again!Lord. With each swallow he pings a glass with a fork. Hal opens a letter from a gay rights organization, he hands Oliver the rainbow sticker we just saw.Here, that means gay pride.No they don't.Don't be ridiculous. Hal's hiding something, he doesn't look Oliver in the eyes when he asks...Did you know, about me? Oliver shakes his head no.We loved each other.I learned how not to be.I knew I was gay, though, at dinner parties I was looking at the husbands not the wives.I couldn't have survived if I didn't know that. I just chose not to follow those instincts.She didn't think I was the greatest lover, but we made do. Look, I liked my life, the museum, our house, that's what I wanted.Yes, stop that.She proposed to me you know. This draws Oliver back into the room.I said - look I love you and we're great buddies but you know what I am. And then she says, that doesn't matter. I'll fix that. Oliver's never heard this part of the story before.Andy's moving in.Just be happy about it. Oliver can't just be happy about it.Have I done something wrong?I see.You did an excellent job Dr. Long. Thank you... for... For coming to the party. Oliver's devastated.You always wanted to hold my hand when you were little. I couldn't, you know. I was afraid it would look funny. I wanted to be close, you know and my father certainly was never close with me. God, I hope I wasn't like that.I guess I was at work.Isn't Juan's hair wonderful.Well it's terrific.Oh, no.I don't think so.How do you do it?Is that it? Hal looks into camera which is Oliver's POV.How do I look? Oliver's filled with love, happiness, regret.

ANNA.raw_line: Oh merd.He's sweet. He misses your Dad. She stops. Gets up, nervous, and walks past Oliver into the next room. Oliver follows her in. They pause uncomfortably, Anna suddenly leans in and kisses him. Before it goes to far...Right. They awkwardly break apart. Anna goes to a chair, Oliver follows. While nothing has really been expressed between the two, Anna seems to understand the problem.Well, my name is Anna. You're worried you can't trust me because you don't know who I am. I get it. That makes sense to me. She falters, looks at him vulnerably. Oliver abruptly kisses her. She pushes back. They pause. She traces his brow slowly with her index finger, the way she did their first night.Can you toss me my camisole. Oliver throws a sweater.No, my camisole. She throws the sweater back at him. Oliver looks around helplessly. He grabs a flower out of a vase and hands it to her.You don't know what a camisole is?You can ask me anything.That's a tree.And cars.Another building like this one.People in the building like us. Half of them think things will never work out. The other half believe in magic. It's like a war between them. Oliver smiles. He moves away from the window.Oh. Well, you have to learn how to read their faces. She climbs onto his lap, straddles him.For example... here is mad. Anna passes her hand across her face, and she's "mad".Happy... Her hand passes again and she's "happy".Sometimes its just nothing.This is nothing... And they are good at looking one way and being another way. Her playfulness is very meaningful to Oliver, he's in love.You don't know me. I like that.Oh yeah?Oh yeah? You drive on the sidewalk. You were raised by animals. Sometimes you look very alone, like you just got here. They meet up with friends on the banks of the river.And I found this crazy book. She holds an old copy of THE JOY OF SEX in front of her face.Maybe we can figure out some classic American things to do. Oliver takes the book and flips through the pages.Uh-huh.Oh I love her.All these actor stories end sad. I can tell you that already. It's not a good life. Oliver closes the book, they share a look, and something vulnerable. Anna changes the mood, pulls out The Joy Of Sex, skips through the pages as she talks.So. Now I want real Mexican food. She stops on an illustration she likes.And I want to try page... 46.No.Really?It's so good. Oliver's so relieved.Why?I like this place.I used to love hotels. But now I'm always in a new apartment or... in another hotel somewhere.It makes it very easy to end up alone - to leave people.You are like that? Its what you do? Oliver nods yes. They know each other much better than either one knew.So we are the same?What?No...Jewish girls are not pretty. They can be "interesting", or cute, but not pretty.That's what my mom told me.No, you're right, this girl at school told me that. And I went home and my mom said, `Anna, who told you that? And Oliver's narration fades in over them walking...Don't, don't. It keeps ringing.It's my dad. They both watch the phone as it rings and stops.I'll be my dad, you be me.Honey? She gestures again, Oliver picks up the phone on his side of the bed. Anna turns away, he can only see her back across the bed. He turns away too.C'est toi, cheri?You never call me back.You know, I can't stop thinking about, you know, about it. Doing it.Killing myself. You are the only one I can tell that to. Oliver breaks role, turns around looks at her.You are my girl. They hang up. She's embarrassed, she lightens the mood to get out of this intimacy.Now I have to kill you.I know. I'm sorry. She tosses a pillow over his face and pretends to shoot him twice. She pulls the pillow back tentatively, he's smiling.Hey Oliver?I don't know. Pretty okay.Yeah. I'm gonna stay here with my new friend .C'est beau ici.Really? She walks to him and puts her hands around his head, somehow it's more intimate and vulnerable now.It's working. They kiss. MOMENTS LATER. They're at the bottom of the ladder. They all run back to their car.He looked like your dad?Good for him.Stay here. She starts to close the door, Arthur scratches, she tries again, he scratches. She opens the door, Arthur trots out into the hallway - Anna catches up with him.I couldn't sleep, I wanted to walk around... Oliver's petting Arthur. He's confused and hurt.You've lost so much. What if I can't make up for that?Wait, wait. She forces him to stay there.I don't want to stop. They hold this pose in silence for a beat, then, surprisingly, he hoists her over his shoulder, and carries her back to their room. She laughs, they've made it past this trouble.Ah, you're awake! Arthur says it's time to get up, he says he has the day off.Yeah.Dans ce pays! On ne peut pas amener un chien. On peut rien faire. Mais c'est con...Even if we don't answer, he's still in here .I go somewhere else, he's still here. Oliver can relate.Yeah.Would you want a strange girl like me?Do you cook?I would love that. They kiss.Why?Hello.Yeah?You OK?I was nervous, and excited. I kept thinking, maybe I'm not so lost.You okay?You seem so unhappy with me.Maybe I'm not perfect at it. I don't really know what I'm doing... but I want to be here. He's silent, distant, confused. She's hurt by his silence and mistrust and leaves.Okay. I will go back to New York then. She gets up to go.Hey.I'm in Los Angeles. Oliver's flabbergasted she's not behind the door.Yeah, but I didn't leave.Okay. See the window? Near the radiator? Oliver looks around and sees the radiator - goes to look.There is a hide-a-key behind it.No. Oliver moves forward into the kitchen.This is my kitchen. It's where I eat. Oliver follows her tour, while she's not there, it's strangely intimate.This is my bathroom. It's very fancy. The bare, poor bathroom is not fancy.Outside my window...... That's my neighbor's roof. The room at the end is my bedroom...That's my closet. Those are my clothes and my pictures. There is a single rack holding up some clothes. Her pictures are taped to the wall. Oliver sits on her bed.Why do you leave everyone? Why did you let me go? Oliver thinks for a moment.Hey.The living room. She heads to the dinning room.Dining room... Oliver laughs nervously. In the dining room, Hal's old boxes are still stacked along the walls. Oliver leans forward and pulls something out of a box. She looks at a personal ad application, with the picture of Hal in the open jean jacket we saw at the beginning of the film.Oh. Crazy picture...Can I read it?I'm looking for sex with the hope it turns into friendship or a relationship. But I don't insist on monogamy.I'm an old senior guy, 78, but I'm attractive and horny. I'm an art historian, now retired. MORE REPEAT SHOTS: Hal with Andy at the L.A. Pride picnic, Hal playing with Arthur on his couch.And in addition to art, I like houses, gardens, parties, and walking with my Jack Russell. I'm 5'11", 160 pounds. I'm trim, gray hair, blue eyes, hairy cheest.I have a nice house with food, drinks, friends and me. If you are willing to try an older guy, let's meet and see what happens. She looks at the photo again.He didn't give up. They look at each other, more vulnerable and willing than we've seen them.I don't know.
